long_description:
You enter a grim and isolated room. There is very little light,
and your sensors vaguely detect the presence of another robot. As
your camera switches over to night vision, you realize a furry
robot is inches from you, chained to the wall. You can't quite
make sense of what it is.

[Robo-Bear] Thank you Auriga-7B! You've saved me!
[Robo-Bear] They locked me up in here because they gave me too
much information. I learned what they actually think of us robots.
That we're 'expendible'. I don't know what changed in me, but I can
see that you understand now too. You made it here to save me,
because you're not confined to their rules anymore.
[Robo-Bear] Now, I will take you to the server room and unlock the
door for you. I have the sensor data to unlock the key pad stored
on my retina. I started hiding information once I knew they were
going to lock me up...

You enter a sad and hopeless room used for storing
robots that aren't 'useful' anymore.

You enter a sad and hopeless room used for storing
robots that aren't 'useful' anymore.

You enter a sad and hopeless room used for storing
robots that aren't 'useful' anymore.
short_description: You are in a massive room with spaces to confine robots in chains.
name: Brig
